Reason: The 'bucket.size' configuration in the 'sunflow' software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact the rendering performance of the system. A smaller bucket size may result in more frequent memory allocations and deallocations, leading to increased overhead and potentially slower rendering times. On the other hand, a larger bucket size may require more memory consumption and could lead to increased cache misses, also affecting performance. Therefore, any change in the 'bucket.size' configuration can have a notable impact on system performance.
